overview: This measure repeals the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. [4] It establishes a new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of conference center programs among the various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System. [4] The bill also appropriates funds out of the new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [4]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ (HB1169_HD1) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026. [3] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. [3]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [3]
agency_impact: Establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses. [4] This would thereby increase access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. [4] The university is authorized to expend funds from the appropriate account in the revolving fund for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses. [3]
economic_impact: Your Committee finds that establishing a single conference center revolving fund within the University of Hawaii System would standardize implementation of conference center programs across the various campuses of the University of Hawaii System, thereby increasing access to conference center usage on University of Hawaii campuses. [4] No other direct economic impact is mentioned in the provided documents. [3]
policy_impact: This measure amends Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by adding a new section to establish the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [3] It repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which relates to the Conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [3] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which relates to the Community college conference center revolving fund. [3]
revenue_sources: The bill establishes the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. [3] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [3] On July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the two repealed revolving funds shall lapse to the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [3]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [3]
operating_revenue_impact: The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing conference center services. [3] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [3] As of July 1, 2025, all unencumbered funds in the conference center revolving fund, university of Hawaii at Hilo; and in the community college conference center revolving fund shall lapse to the new fund. [3]
capital_expenditure_impact: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [3]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [3]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The previous fiscal note stated that 'appropriations and encumbrances' would be transferred. [4] The current version clarifies that all 'unencumbered funds' in the repealed revolving funds shall 'lapse' to the new fund. [3] The most significant change is the effective date, which was changed from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4]
fte_positions: The provided legislative documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [3]
appropriations_changes: The previous fiscal note indicated an unspecified appropriation for fiscal year 2025-2026. [3] The current version of the bill maintains this unspecified appropriation. [3]
funding_sources_changes: The funding source remains the newly created University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [3] No changes in funding sources have been made between versions. [3]
department_impact: The University of Hawaii remains the department responsible for expending the appropriated sum. [3] There has been no change in departmental responsibility. [3]
reports_required: The university shall prepare and submit an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [3]
pilot_program: The provided legislative documents do not establish a pilot program. [3] The bill establishes a permanent revolving fund. [3]
sunset_date: The provided legislative documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [3]
effective_date: The effective date in the previous version was July 1, 2025. [4] This version changes the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4]
